731009f-a.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge.
731009f-a.text:
LOOKING TOWARD GOTHAM FROM THE TRIBORO BRIDGE TOWER.
Astoria, L.I. ---- A Panorama of Manhattan spires greets this ironworker as he looks toward the New York skyline from the Astoria tower of the Triboro Bridge, The project, started 16 years ago, will be finished in 1956. Through government funds it has given jobs to 18,000 men. The series of bridges will connect Manhattan, Brooklyn, and the Bronx and will be one of the greatest projects of its kind in engineering history.
International News Photo  1934

731017f-a.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - [Astoria, Queens.]
731017f-a.text:
(1)
Triboro Bridge. A northerly view showing from back to foreground the Gas Tanks of the Astoria Light, Heat and Power Company ; the Approach to the Hell Gate Bridge, and the excavation for the supports to the Triboro Bridge. The last two are in Astoria Park.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, looking south, showing the Triboro Tower in Astoria Park. Beyond it is Pot Cove; a part of Hell Gate which is a part
of the East River.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2 views, not dry mount items.)

Triboro and Hell Gate Bridges. lIn view No. 1 is seen from fore to background the above named bridges. In the foreground is the Triboro(under construction). The Hell Gate is shown spanning the east channel between Wards lIsland (left and Astoria Park, Queens (right). The roadway shown skirting the river's edge is Shore
Boulevard; the view being northward.
June 12, 1935.

(2)

Park.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)

November 9, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

731031f-a.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - Queens approach.
731031f-a.text:
(1)
Triboro Bridge, west from elevatednstation of the Astoria lines,at Twenty-fifth Ave. and 31st Street. On the left side of the approach is Hoy) Ave South; on the right is the future Hoyt Ave. North. Iitersecting streets are: 30th,229th, and 28th Streets. The arched span
shown has an anchorage in Astoria Park.
November 9, 1935.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing also in the right background the Hell Gate Bridge;
a railroad structure that parallels this new span.
November 9, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same at 27th Street and Hoyt Ave.; a point of vantage slightly
westward.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3 views, not dry mount items).

730991f-b.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge.
730991f-b.text:
(1)
Triborough Bridge: The Manhattan Approach as viewed in a northward direction from the foot of E. 122nd Street in Manhattan. In the background appears the southernmost tip of the Bronx.
August 18, 1936
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A slightly earlier view, showing the Bridge structure and the
shoreline in a formative stage.
March 8, 1936
P. L. Sperr

(2)
A slightly earlier view, showing the Bridge structure and the
shoreline in a formative stage.
March 8, 1936
P. L. Sperr

730987f-b.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge.
730987f-b.text:
Triboro Bridge: The Manhattan Approach and the northern end of the East River Drive under construction. The view is northward in Nos. 1 and 2, from a point east of Pleasant Ave., at East 122nd Street. No. 3 is in a southeastward direction from the Willis - First Ave. Bridge, across the Harlem River. Note in the background of this picture, the other span of this Bridge, that connects Ward's Island with Queens.
May 18, 1936
P.L. Sparr

more or less similar view.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

731039f-a.title: Bridges - Triborough and Hell Gate Bridges - [East River.]
731039f-a.text:
The Triboro and the Hellgate Bridges as viewed from the air and spanning the east channel of the East River. To the left is Wards Island and to the right Astoria, Queens. Beyond is the Hunts Pont section of the Bronx (left), Rikers Island (center), Bowery Bay, Flushing Bay and the College Point-Whitestone section of Queens. View No. 3 is a duplicate of No. 2 tho darker.
1937
Views: 1-2-3
W. P. A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project

731039f-b.title: Bridges - Triborough and Hell Gate Bridges - [East River.]
731039f-b.text:
The Triboro and the Hellgate Bridges as viewed from the air and spanning the east channel of the East River. To the left is Wards Island and to the right Astoria, Queens. Beyond is the Hunts Pont section of the Bronx (left), Rikers Island (center), Bowery Bay, Flushing Bay and the College Point-Whitestone section of Queens. View No. 3 is a duplicate of No. 2 tho darker.
1937
Views: 1-2-3
W. P. A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project

the East River and Manhattan, beyond.

of the Hell Gate Bridge of the New York Central R.R.

Approach's to the bridge proper.

125th Street) Approach.
January 1937.
George D. Chinn.
Wof sclryrnowo/ Ne6,

Street.
January 1937.
George D. Chinn.

shore (Dutch Kills).
September 1937.
George D. Chinn.
(Not a dry mount item).

730994f-b.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge.
730994f-b.text:
Triborough Bridge: The Mahhattan Approach to same at the foot of East 125th Street, as viewed eastward from the 2nd Avenue "gl" station. First Avenue runs across the view and connects with the Willis Avenue Bridge over the Harlem River. The latter structure is at the left and does not appear. The iron lattice work there and which apparently is same, is in actuality the Bronx Approach to the Triborough Bridge. The tenements in the foreground extend
from 2nd Avenue to 1st Avenue.
June 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

730994f-a.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge.
730994f-a.text:
Triborough Bridge: The Mahhattan Approach to same at the foot of East 125th Street, as viewed eastward from the 2nd Avenue "gl" station. First Avenue runs across the view and connects with the Willis Avenue Bridge over the Harlem River. The latter structure is at the left and does not appear. The iron lattice work there and which apparently is same, is in actuality the Bronx Approach to the Triborough Bridge. The tenements in the foreground extend
from 2nd Avenue to 1st Avenue.
June 7, 1940

P. L. Sperr

731002f-a.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - [Harlem River lift span.]

731034f-c.title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge - Manhattan Approach.
731034f-c.text:
(1)
Triboro Bridge: The Manhattan Approach as viewed eastward on East 125th Street at First Ave. The new East River Drive will have a circular by-pass approach to this structure and will be on the right.
January 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same structure slightly later. The constructdon shack seen,is at the N.E. corner of First Ave. (foreground) at East 124th Street;
the view being northeastward.
March 10, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same date as No. 2; viewing in the opposite direction and showing this new structure crossing the old Willis Ave. - First Ave., Harlem River Bridge. The tenements seen,face on the south side of
East 126th Street, between First and Second Aves.
March 10, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3 views, not dry mount items).

731015f-b.title: Bridges - triborough Bridge.
731015f-b.text:
(1)
Triboro Bridge, west from foreground at about 24th Street, showing at the left Hoyt Avenue South viewed west. In the center is the site upon which the arches for the support of the Approash to the bridge
are to be constructed.
September 20, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, further west, showing at the right 21st Street, viewed north to the Hell Gate Bridge Approach. Also shown is the north
side of Hoyt Avenue North beyond the Triboro arches.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)  The same, a northwest view, showing also in the background the
Hell Gate Bridge.
June 12, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3 views, not dry mount items.)
